column11: Review Text

Lovely beach beautiful waves. The only downside was being harassed by locals re tour trips and Tuk Tuk rides. Even to the point where a local came into the sea to talk to us. Because of this we stopped using the beach. Which was a shame as we would have liked to have spent more time there.

I went to a surf school on this beach. An excellent instructor for beginners, explains everything right away, finds an approach to adults and children. At the same time, it will be a lesson, not just riding the waves, and then you can practice on your own üòä
Great beach, good entrance to the ocean. There are waves in the ocean, you need to be careful. There are no side currents, we swam calmly
This is a very quiet and peaceful beach and endless lovely walks.  Swimming is lovely and highly recommend you visit.  Lots of hotels along the beach but most have their own pools.

column8: One of the beach you can make best experience
column11: One of the beach can give you the best experience. This is another beautiful beach in Sri Lanka, which attracts a lot of people. This is one of the must-visit destinations to make your evening an enjoyable experience.q

column8: Like a film set but rough seas and sadly lots of rubbish.
column11: Very peaceful as only locals are there and it is a huge length. It is incredibly beautiful however the water is way to rough to swim in with big strong waves and quickly becoming deep. In addition sadly there is a reasonable amount of rubbish all along the beach. i am not sure if it is washed in or locally dropped however it is way too much and it is unsightly. The big picture though is very beautiful with the local fishing boats etc.,
Delicious food Excellent service Beautiful location Frindly staff Keep it up,invited many more guset..have excellent vacation thanks for everything.

This is one of the main attractions of the coastal town that stretches continuously for a long distance. It is quite popular among both local and foreign tourists alike due to the bright, sunny skies, great views of the sunset, and the golden shores. There are plenty of restaurants, hotels and other types of accommodations by the beach.
Lovely villas in peacefull setting and a lovely pool. Villas are well equipped and owners are really lovely and helpfull .

We stayed on Wadduwa beach. The beach is long and empty most of the time plenty of space and definitely not crowded with tourists. The waves are great fun but can get a little rough in the afternoon. I watched the fisherman go out in their boat and drop a massive net in the sea and pull in their catch. Everyone comes to help. We also sat on the beach and watched the sunset which was amazing.
Wadduwa beach is my favorite! Not crowded at all, you will follow local life, see how local fishermen catch fish. Wide sandy beach, lot of places for dining.

Wadduwa Beach like most beaches in Sri-Lanka is a nice place, to enjoy the sea & to relax & even have a bath. As its close to most  hotels & resorts in Wadduwa , if one stays  in any  of the surrounding hotels or guest houses, one has easy access to the beach. Well worth a visit.
The beach in Wadduwa is nice, clean and deserted. The Beach is perfect for watching the sunsets. The restaurants are not many and off, but close, to the beach.
One of the nearest beach to Colombo. Best time evening sunset at wadduwa beach. Large beach good for walking. I will be back again soon.

Wadduwa beach is one of the most amazing beaches in SL. Each day you will be able to see a spectacular sun set view which I doubt can be seen in any other beaches. This beach gives you a relaxing sensation which will make you stay there for hours. Just try making a visit and experience it yourself.
Had awesome photographs in this beach. Willing to post in future. Love this beach. Come to visit this beach you will have unforgettable memories.
At the time we visited the beach was clean and the sea safe. Lots of bird life abound, you may even get a visit from 'Monica' an Indian elephant.
Stunning beach perfect for long walks came across old gent catching crabs the old traditional way was a great experience
Wadduwa beach needs to be cleaned, its beautiful but there is a quite amount of pollution that needs to be cleared for locals and foreigners to enjoy its serenity and beauty

I‚Äôm not sure why so many of these reviews rate Wadduwa so highly. It‚Äôs extremely dirty (water, sand, foreshore and backstreets), lacking in any sort of beach amenities (two local restaurants along the entire strip), has no discernible attractive features (just a long, straight beach - no reef, no islands, no headlands, no... nothing!), and extremely uninviting from a swimming/surfing point of view (dirty, as mentioned above, muddled surf, and significant rip currents - dangerously so for any but the more experienced). Do yourself a favour and travel a bit further down the coast to Galle and beyond to have a decent beach holiday in Sri Lanka. In closing, I have to offer my deepest sympathy to Sri Lankans following the Easter Sunday bombings, and all the other horrors we‚Äôve experienced in the following days. Truly a tragedy for a country just beginning to heal its civil war scars.

I was rating I this hotel for One night. Excellent and Clean Rooms with Balconies. Wonderful Young Staff from the Front Office, House Keeping, Service as well as the Chefs. Good Food and great service. Large swimming pool. Shady Gardon. I was very happy with my overall Stay. Thank you Mr. Mohan Manager, Executive Chef and Rest of the Team for making my stay memorable..
Very quiet beach. Ideal place to watch the sunset. Unfortunately during our stay the red flag was out so couldn't swim in the sea.

This beach offers a nice sunset however it is the dirties beach I have seen in Sri Lanka. At the time of our visit, this beach had washed up plastic, wood, trees trunks and syringes. I dont recommend walking along this beach and the water has strong currents so its not a comfortable to swim in.
Lovely beach but please be careful in the water! Can be hard going if not very careful, but sand lovely and clean outside our hotel Blue Water.
üëçüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩ Wonderful look view sea and people can swim in sea or near pool in hotel well ;-) hope people visit in Sri Lanka face smile
Real Indian ocean, real nature, not many people, still looking a little bit wild, ideal for those who don't like to swim surrounded by crowds of people.

A beautiful beach, but very empty. It could do with some beach bars and sun beds. I have read other reviews which mention litter I never saw much litter. There were dogs but they did not cause any problems

Lovely long beach, with hotels and coconut trees along it. Its a public beach so not many hotel sun beds cluttering it up. There are a few vendors selling fresh king coconuts and you can see them climbing the trees to collect them on a morning. There is sadly some litter around - but not excessive, and dogs. But then you will see this everywhere in Sri Lanka. Perhaps the hotels in the area could start a beach clearing and dog neutering program - it would be great for the environment and animal welfare and may even help the locals to earn a little extra money. Great sunsets and good waves too
Hi everyone , if you like to make some memorable holiday please contact Tapro Tours for joyfully  excursion around Sri Lanka.

Enjoyed on this beach with family and friends. It is a granular sand beach, shallow with very clean waters. the feel of walking on eh sand is very nice and the sand does not irritate you or stick to your body.
I love it there. We enjoyed the hotel in Wadduwa The Blue Waters. Good for relaxation. It city on the long beaches. You can go everywhere
I have no words for this place. It‚Äôs dirty, full of trash, pigs, cows. No beach bars, restaurants. It‚Äôs empty sad place. I regret coming to this city and this beach. Simply ugly.
Not a bad beach, not protected so have to keep a close watch on smaller children in the waves.  Area we were at was clean but got annoyed at hawkers trying to sell tours.
Lovely beach with ideal view point for locals net fishing, must watch!! Watch out for unwanted locals trying to rip you off, hotels advise not to go to beach at night!

Nice Clean Beach with high waves, safe to bath, due to strong waves - one can not swim! Safe to take long walk - very pleasant - morning & evening stroll.Sight to enjoy sun set! Chetan. Ottawa, Canada üá®üá¶
Lovely picture postcard beach, lovely to waltz up and down on. The seas a winter one this time of year so bit choppy but nice.

Great for a walk on the beach but the waves and the rip tide is strong. Would recommend only if you are a good swimmer. Nice strong breeze blowing all day which is great for the hot days. Not very busy except for the tourists.
It's difficult to have a swim there , beach is somewhat good for walking around. The area infront the Blue Water hotel is very good,  clean and nice. Recommended to visit in the evening
The beach outside the Blue Water hotel in Wadduwa is awesome and should not be missed if visiting Sri Lanka.

I find this beach very beautiful,esoecially because it is still wild and the humans are not so visible.Nice experience when u see in each morning the fishing man who they recovery their nets from ocean.
Nice beach, not as dirty as beached nearer to Colombo. But if you want to experience good beaches go towards southern part of Sri Lanka.
This is the first beach after 3 weeks in Sri Lanka where we spent hours in the water. The waves are small, the water is warm, it is quiet and there wasn‚Äôt any undertow.
Very beautiful beach side near by main citiy of colombo.easly you can get relaxing sea waves arround you.
The sunsets on the beach were spectacular. The beach was very clean and beautiful. On some days, there were elephants on the beach for rides.
You have to take care which part of the beach you use. It was an excellent place for watching the local fisherman bringing in the daily catch. Some areas are a little dirty.
The see is rough most of the time. Also not properly made for bathing. Only for people who are well trained. Otherwise risky.
Lovely beach with great views and sunsets. A little stormy in April / May time and not many people went for a swim. Big waves.
Too rough for swimming this time of the year (Sept). Relaxing for walks anytime of the yeatüëçüèΩ. We will visit next year again.

Wadduwa beach very long and beautiful,  especially at night. At ten oclock, when you want to walk on the beach you meet a lot of crabs, they run around the coast, little, middle, big....they so intresting and have funny eyes. We met with local peaple and they taught and helped us to hunt crabs - its so crazy and cool. Then we had very tasty crabs dinner on the beach, along, with torches and drums. It was the one of most exciting moment in our travel.Thanks our new friend "Chan", if you will be there, I recomend you to visit the beach cafe "Chan", near the "Villa Ocean view hotel"

The sea which is fairly agitated and most of the time the flag is red for swimming. The sea bring a lot of rubbish on the beach which is not that clean. It is said to be much better during the high season in October, November, December The beaches are better further down south to Bentota. Still sunsets are beautiful

We stayed near Wadduwa beach for 2 nights in July. I think it was just the time of year we stayed, but the beach was very dirty with lots of trash brought in by the tide. The locals told us the beach is cleaner later in the year. That aside the beach has very few amenities, we walked for about 20 minutes only finding 2 restaraunts on the beach. There are no sun beds on the beach, only in the tourist resorts. It is a very pretty beach if you find a spot without trash, and it's very peaceful as there were no tourists on the beach in our visit. We only met locals on the beach. You can watch the local fisherman at work on the beach which is fun. Galle road is about 5 minutes walk from the beach and has some restaraunts and shops but nothing exciting near the beach. The tides are very strong on Wadduwa beach so be careful. If you want a beach holiday in Sri Lanka I suggest you go to Galle.
This is a very good beach close to Colombo down south.A good beach to spend time with your friends and family .
The Wadduwa beach was very clean during our visit and the sea was very calm. Nice place to spend an evening with your partner.
good beach,dont expect to find loungers ,very unspoiled,can be dirty ,and some parts not good for swimming.
We are going to the beach to find its beauty to have a closer look and clean air so i think this is the one place I experienced both of them work
The ocean water was so warm, sand soft, current ok even with children .  Great time playing in the waves.
Peaceful beach to relax and enjoy the nature. Can be either romantic or a fantastic family getaway. Loved it!
The beach is a beautiful strip of sand, where you can watch the fishermen daily haul in fishing nets onto the beach. The sea however has strong currents, and i would not recommend swimming
Wadduwa Beach was one of the best places I've been which never lets you fed up experiencing the waters.

Walked to here from Kalutara beach, a nice walk and stopped off for a drink in the area. A  peaceful beach with nice sand, like everywhere else a little untidy in places but no hawkers. Nice quiet walk and nice views.

Wadduwa beach is 30 km away (1 hour ride) from the capital city Colombo Sri lanka. ideal place to visit if your are in a business trip and busy schedule. Can use the train and public transport to get there. No much restaurants like in Mt Lavinia but cleaner and less crowded . There are lot of beach hotels near wadduwa area
The Wadduwa beach is big and offers great place for relax. The sand is good and the water is hot + not very deep so it makes it perfect for children...
Beautiful beach. Watch fishermen bring in their catch. Out of this world sunsets.Nearby dining place.
I stayed on the third floor of Ocean Queen Hotel which is right in front of this beach. I strolled on the beach many times during my two nights stay and I loved it. The only nuisance is dogs.
We were staying at Serene Pavilions, the beach is dirty in front of the Hotel , lot of plastic cans/ old rags / twigs  etc... if you planing a beach holiday pls avoid Wadduwa Sri Lanka

A nice long Beach to tan, run or stroll along.  Seems best in the early morning or late afternoon. Kept super clean very early in the morning outside blue water beach hotel. The pull of the current makes it dangerous to swim. The view is amazing and absolutely lovely and close to the blue water hotel and wadduwa laya beach resort.
Amazing beautiful beach the sea was too rough to swim in but we did paddle and Walked along the water edge of ages. All good and beautiful sunrises and sunsets.
